entry.title: Learning VCL: How to Build a VCL Component Demo
entry.content:
In my previous post, I described how to get started with the VCL. VCL is a highly modular CSS framework and unfortunately it does not have a demo/documentation page at the moment so it may be hard to guess how to use a particular component or how it looks like. So in this blog post, I will explain how to build the demo example for a VCL component. I will use the gallery component as an example.

  1. Make sure you have the recent version of the VCL gallery component:

cd vcl/gallery git checkout master git pull

  1. Install node modules required to generate the demo:

npm install

  1. Make sure you have the node 0.10.* installed because the generation of examples fails for nodejs 0.11.* due to an issue in the connect module:

n 0.10.32

  1. Generate the demo:

npm test

This will start a local web server and it will open the example page in the browser. By default, http://localhost:8000/example.html should be opened:

If you navigate to the root http://localhost:8000/, you’ll see all available examples for the component.
